title: So what is the counter play to Graves?
body:
?

Ever since his rework this champion has been completely bland non interactive to play against and frustrating. He doesn't even need to gank a single lane because he scales so well and two shots everyone late game, "oh but his winrate goes down late game so wait" wait for what late game doesn't even exist and his win rate still hovers close to that 50% even if you get there. He can get nearly 150+ armor and magic resistance without building a single fucking resistance item, like who thought that would be a genius idea? 

He stays way too healthy in the jungle because he can infinity kite meanwhile Kindred needed to be gutted having a mediocre 42% win rate early due to weak clear. He scales way too well with life steal items for a tank (yes I'm going to call this piece of shit a tank) and other items like PD giving him too much dueling potential. Right now he can piratically 1v1 and outpace almost any jungler early with the exception of maybe Kha'Zix and Rengar. Don't even get my started with lethality build.

This champion ever since his rework has been completely disgusting and unfun to play against meanwhile Riot balance team is taking an extended vacation thinking Graves is healthy for this game? Lmao what a joke. 

Revert his rework it's been a complete failure ever since his rework he's been problematic, regardless if he's "meta".

/End Rant and Salt.

I can't help but notice that you didn't actually manage to address how Graves has no counterplay. It's likely because you're not very intelligent and are using it as a buzzword to make your post seem more legitimate than it is, when Graves does in fact have counterplay, more than most marksmen.

So first of all, Graves is the only champion in the game whose auto attacks can be body blocked by someone else. Late game his DPS and survivability fall off a bit, leaving him with his burst, leaving his autos to be body blocked by your tank. Furthermore, his attack speed is fixed and he has a reload mechanic, meaning you know how many shots he can take before he blows his load.

His Q also has counterplay, being that it has a delay for the fallback damage (the bulk of the damage), and of course he only gets the instant fallback if it hits a wall, meaning you can counter it with your positioning as well.

His W has the counterplay of walking out of it, though this is admittedly less notable than the previous two abilities.

His E is just a short-ranged dash that gives him a durability steroid. There's not much counterplay because it doesn't do much. You can still stop him mid dash obviously.

His ult is a long range relatively narrow skill shot that you can avoid by dodging it or, if he's firing it at your front line, not positioning in the blast cone.

Graves is OP right now, but to claim that he has no counterplay when his autos can literally be body blocked by a minion is stupid.

I'm going to start out by saying fuck Graves.

That being said... the real counterplay to him is your team. He has to dash in to access his damage and resistances, but that puts him in a spot where your team can burst him down. If your team can't burst him down, you lose.

He was designed around having a really strong former-half of a match while not having as much to offer in the latter-half--when the teamfights start happening, because all he can do is chuck physical AOEs and dance around. If he doesn't get too many kills off and your team comp has a stronger mid-to-lategame presence then you'll probably come out ahead.

He also gets a lot of free resistances and can itemize HP pretty easily for a champ who does so much damage, so one needs to pay attention to/capitalize off of what what he is/isn't building.
